task.summary: 1) Created backend for user creation and storing to PostgreSQL 2) Implemented a search function to search user by id, last name and email. 3) Tested all the above by giving input from Postman REST client

1) Created a file passport.js to implement the JwtStrategy 2) Protected the dashboard route using passport.authenticate 3) Removed getUserByLastName as it conflicts with /users/dashboard request 4) Reformatted code in the all files
Removed the 'JWT' prefix from the token
Changed the token's maximum lifetime to 10 minutes.

1) Created backend for user creation and storing to PostgreSQL 2) Implemented a search function to search user by id, last name and email. 3) Tested all the above by giving input from Postman REST client

1) Created backend for user creation and storing to PostgreSQL 2) Implemented a search function to search user by id, last name and email. 3) Tested all the above by giving input from Postman REST client
Created the UI for interacting with the backend Node JS server
Formatted the syntax for a few files
Formatted the syntax in a few model files and changed the invocation of "getUserByUserName" function in passport.js to be invoked from User.getUserByUserName to db.user.getUserByUserName
Added both local and remote DB configurations to the database.js file
Changed the schema for questions and answers

Wrote backend for dashboard in users.js for the route /dashboard. - The data is retrieved by joining the questions table with the answers table thereby showing each question and the various answers for it.

UI ==
1) Created a Notification Service to display toast 2) Changed the dynamic state variable in onChangeListener to e.target.name

Model ===== Changed the getUserByName function in Post question backend to getUserById
UI == 1) Changed the text box used to hold question body to a text area in questions.js 2) Formatted the code in questions.js 3) Changed "Tags" field in "Ask a Question" page to a dropdown

Changed the token's maximum lifetime to 10 minutes.
